{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dysphonia plica ventricularis refers to the pathological interference of the false vocal folds during phonation. According to the documents, ventricular dysphonia is characterized by a typical rough, low-pitched voice quality resulting from false vocal fold vibration. Therefore, in Dysphonia plica ventricularis, sound is produced by the false vocal cords.", "answer_choice": "A"}
